Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
@Sir Seven the other reason i left the getnewaddress output on the first screen is to minimize the steps needed to onboard a new user.
basically it is run ./nspv, browse 127.0.0.1:port
copy the wif, login
have somebody send funds, click refresh
then can send funds. basically onboarded pretty much instantly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i just dont like having to keep clicking many times to do the main thing i want to do. and once you have a wif, you just use it to login

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course wif are not user friendly, so this probably needs to be changed to some standard set of 12 words...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: think of it as a low level GUI. given the screen shots and control flow of the current, some UX specialist can specify the changes needed

Author: Sir Seven#7158
Content:
Well, generally there are 3 inputs and 3 errors possible:
incorrect send, incorrect broadcast and non-valid wif to login with.
Plus random path like `http://127.0.0.1:&port/random/path/here` - might be good idea to redirect it.
Is it possible to pass internal error messages like `error: invalid address or amount too small` to standard error page?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: FYI I will post at least a 1000 HUSH bounty for somebody to help HUSH use all the latest/greatest superlite nSPV stuff GUI stuff. We have all the full node internals merged in. I know things are in flux and want to help development. 1000 HUSH is just to get a basic superlite gui Hush wallet using nSPV. More bounties are available for additional work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you just need to make a coins file entry like ILN has

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then you can ./nspv HUSH3

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and it will appear on the localhost:hushrpcport

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: really you just need a single fullnode running the latest dev branch or below

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: use that as a seed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and getting the netmagic added to coins file

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then nspv will automatically configure to connect to the p2p network and http://127.0.0.1:port will display the GUI

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so far it has worked seamlessly between KMD, NSPV and ILN chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @dukeleto i think if you just run it, you will see what i mean.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
@grewalsatinder a few improvements for the html:
need error pages for: incorrect send, incorrect broadcast and non-valid wif to login with.
maybe a single error page where i can just display some text, or can even be three different error pages, whichever is easier

also on the wallet page, a new row below the coin/balance/address that has a mempool section. so a button like "Update" which would send the mempool query and then it would show a list of txids for any incoming funds. this will also catch sends if there was any change, so only tx that are sent but have not change will not appear. it seems a good compromise. maybe it will be like the txid history in how it is displayed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: right now the mempool is invisible to nspv

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but it has the ability to scan the mempool for transactions coming into any specific address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: like your addresss

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but this is a network request

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so like the "refresh" button is required to refresh the history

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we have an "update" button to refresh the "unconfirmed transactions" section

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: basically a transaction history like section that is for "Unconfirmed Transactions"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: user finds out someone is supposed to have sent him funds, but it doesnt show in his balance or history

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: he can then click "update" and see if the tx was already sent or not
